newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco buys 50,000T wheat for January - official.
newsitem.headline: Morocco buys 50,000T wheat for January - official.

text.p: Morocco purchased 50,000 tonnes soft wheat at $173.50 and $180.20 per tonne C&F for January delivery, the state Office Interprofessionnel des Cereales et Legumineuses (ONICL) said on Tuesday.
A first lot of 30,000 tonnes of French wheat was bought at $180.20 per tonne including freight and the cost of a Coface export credit, for delivery to the southern port of Agadir, ONICL said.
The second lot of 20,000 tonnes of optional wheat was acquired at $173.5 per tonne C&F for delivery to the northern ports of Tangier and Nador.
The two lots are due to arrive between January 1-10, 1997, ONICL said.
The tender took place on Monday afternoon, it added. --Rabat newsroom +212-7 726518
